Crisis Support

ThriveNYC | NYC Well

Crisis Support

  1. What to know
  2. How to get Help?
  3. Other ways to get help

Support during a crisis

In New York City, support is always available in the most difficult of moments. Talk to an NYC Well counselor; itâ€™s free, confidential, and available 24/7. Additionally, mobile crisis teams staffed by health professionals, can offer support to an individual in crisis in their home.

Mobile crisis teams offer a range of services, including:

  • Assessment
  • Crisis intervention
  • Supportive counseling
  • Information and referrals, including to community-based mental health services

Request help from a mobile crisis team if a family member, friend, or acquaintance is experiencing (or at risk of) a psychological crisis. You can also request a team for yourself.

How to get Help?

Talk to a counselor or request a mobile crisis team

1-888-NYC-WELL (1-888-692-9355)

Available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week

Text a counselor

Text 'WELL' to 65173

Chat with a counselor online

Go to nyc.gov/nycwell

Other ways to get help

Visit NYC Well to learn more about who to call during a crisis.Learn more about the City's services for people in crisis and how to request support here: https://www1.nyc.gov/site/doh/health/health-topics/crisis-emergency-services-mobile-crisis-teams.page
